reviews.review_msg: LOVED Dr. Douglas!!! I took psyc268 with him in fall 2023 and let's just say I think about it non-stop-- especially after taking psyc379. Sad to see he's on leave currently, but hopefully he will be back at the university soon because I would love to take more classes he teaches during my time left in undergrad!

kevin is an excellent professor. classes were early in the morning and i would make the effort to drive from surrey at 6am everyday to be on time but it was so worth it. a professor can really make or break a class. kept his class interested. i had to switch universities but he is one professor from my university experience i will not forget!

Dr. Douglas is such an excellent professor - highly recommend taking any of his classes! His lectures are really good and he shares a ton of interesting stories. He provides access to all the textbooks, chapters, readings for free and his grading criteria is clear for assignments - 1 midterm, 1 project and a final exam - and he curves the grades.

Kevin is awesome! Incredibly knowledgeable, fair, and engaging. His expectations from students are always very clear and transparent, and he never tries to "trick" the class when it comes to exams or assignments. I don't think you could find a better professor for forensic psych at SFU- I would highly recommend taking any course you can with him!

One of the best psych profs at SFU in my opinion. Course content is definitely a bit challenging, end of term assignment is brutal in terms of workload but quite fun to do. His lectures are great and he adds humor to such a heavy topic. Would recommend it other than the fact that it's an 8:30 class but id say 50% of classes are online so its okay

Kevin is a great prof. However, we were only graded in the class by two exams and an assignment. So everything is weighed pretty heavily. The content itself is not challenging though and really enjoyable.

Kevin's an excellent professor who cares about students. Lectures are really interesting and applicable, and he provided the textbook for free which was appreciated. Class discussions and questions are encouraged so there was a lot of participation and attendance in this class compared to others. Flexible and fair with assignments-highly recommend.

I Had him for My Gang Violence seminar class. We had journal articles for our readings. His lectures were really interesting. We were expected to have questions on our readings but he also had us submit our opinions by email in case people were shy. A good section of our lecture was class discussion, which I found really helped me learn the topics.

The final assignment was really straightforward, easy, and actually interesting! You get to choose between a HCR assessment with a lit review or a term paper. Lectures were engaging and actually interesting, and is true to what the SFU course description says, unlike some other courses at SFU. Overall, this was my fave course at SFU.

took this class spring 2020 during covid-19. textbook is provided free. lecture slides are posted but carry minimal info, definitely need to attend lecture and read textbook. Prof. Douglas does try to make lecture entertaining with jokes, definitely not dry & boring. lots of material to study, but if you do so the tests are pretty straightforward

Hes the best I truly enjoyed studying!! Hes so knowledgeable and makes detailed normally not interesting psyc assessments interesting and enjoyable as he is experienced in the field. He has so much personal memories he shares during the lectures, it is one of the classes I didnt get bored at all Cant wait to take another class with him!!!

I really enjoyed this class with Kevin! Exams can be difficult as you're tested on scientific journal articles, but the class is curved so you'll end up doing really well if you put in the effort. He's a great lecturer - very funny and engaging.

Kevin is a great teacher. Makes lectures fun and interesting. Must attend class as his slides are vague which he expands on in class. Tests are fair and non-cumulative with 1 term paper you can write about almost anything highly recommend

I loved his class. Kevin is a great professor. He is so real and he does a good job explaining the concepts. I didn't have too much of a forensic background but I genuinely enjoyed his class. Make sure you go to lecture since half of his notes are not on the powerpoints and do your readings! Probably one of my favourite classes of my undergrad!

Oh. My. God. KD is the BEST PROFESSOR. I am so inspired by his achievements and overall amazing personality, taking this course made me want to succeed. He is unbelievably helpful and so extremely clear with his course content. He really cares about the field and will go the extra mile to help his students, discussions are always encouraged. Do it!
Brilliant, interesting, interested, relevant, current, experienced, available ...... Amazing prof.
Great prof! Very interesting stories. Final project is fun (risk assessment). lectures are a must and exams are fair but a little harder gotta study.. Loved this class highly recommended

Kevin is the bomb, I love him. He actually acts HUMAN in lecture and makes jokes and stuff. Even if you don't love forensics or anything, this class killed. His exams are fair and are scaled if they are not. One of SFU's best profs, TAKE THIS CLASS.

I went into this class not knowing what to expect. Kevin is very engaging and keeps the topics interesting. The exams are hard and asks about details in the readings, but as long as you pay attention in class & do the readings, you'll be fine. the grades are scaled too. Loved this class.
No Comments
Sometimes gets confused in class about the material he is teaching, loses focus, but definitely a career academic!

He covered the material very well and clearly in class.  He brought in his own research which made the otherwise dry material very interesting and easy to understand.  The tests related well to the material and the assignments were fun and relevant to the class content.

Kevin is an awesome professor. Went through information so clearly and slowly making a seemlingly unteeresting class my favorite one this semester. Oh, and he's so sexy that even if the class was boring, it would still be enjoyable to go to!! :)
A very good prof - encourages and answers questions. Gives great examples/case studies.The course itself is a bit dry and boring.

Kevin is one of the nicest teachers. He is very calm & any questions or concerns you may have that you present to him, he makes sure your questions are answered & that you have a complete understanding. During lectures, he speaks slowly & explains EVERYTHING in detail.
